title: Honey Garlic Wings
description: Sticky and flavorful chicken wings with a sweet honey-garlic glaze.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Arrange chicken wings on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes.
In a saucepan, mix honey, minced garlic, soy sauce, and olive oil. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Coat the wings with the glaze and bake for another 10 minutes.

title: Hot Wings
description: Spicy chicken wings coated in a tangy hot sauce glaze.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Arrange chicken wings on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes.
In a saucepan, combine hot sauce, butter, vinegar, and garlic powder. Heat until melted and combined.
Toss the wings in the sauce and bake for another 10 minutes.

title: Marinated Wine and Thyme Steak
description: A tender steak marinated in red wine and thyme for a flavorful main course.
steps: Place the steak in a shallow dish and pour the red wine over it.
Add thyme, black pepper, and salt. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
Remove the steak from the marinade and cook to your desired doneness.

title: Brown Sugar Carrots
description: Sweet and tender carrots glazed with brown sugar and butter.
steps: Boil the carrots until tender and drain.
In a skillet, melt butter and stir in the brown sugar and salt.
Add the carrots and toss until glazed.

title: Irish Soda Bread
description: A traditional Irish bread made with baking soda, buttermilk, and a hearty crumb.
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
Slowly add buttermilk and knead until a dough forms.
Shape the dough into a round loaf and bake for 40–45 minutes.

title: No-crust Spinach and Egg Quiche
description: A savory quiche with spinach, protein rich cheese, and fluffy eggs.
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F
Grate the carrot & chop the mushrooms, or any other vegetable you want to prepare
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, heavy cream, salt, pepper and vegetables
Mix the chopped spinach and shredded cheese in with everything else.
Bake for 60 minutes or until the quiche is set and golden brown.

title: Rolled Omelette
description: A tamago-style omelette with layers of egg rolled with ingredients inside.
steps: Crack and beat the eggs in a bowl. Add the heavy cream and mix until smooth.
Preheat a small to medium-sized pan over medium-high heat. Once hot, add oil or butter to coat the pan.
Pour a thin layer of the egg mixture into the pan and cook until it sets, like a pancake.
Use a spatula to lift one side of the egg and roll it over gently, about 1 cm at a time, creating a crepe-like roll.
Shift the rolled egg to one side of the pan and pour in an additional layer of egg mixture.
Place a small amount of the chopped onion and shredded cheese along the edge where the new layer meets the rolled egg.
Repeat the rolling and layering process until all the whisked egg mixture and ingredients are used up.

title: Chamomile Tea
description: Single serving of soothing flowery mint chamomile tea
steps: add boiling water to flowers in kettle or tea strainer
steep flowers for approx. 10 minutes

title: Grilled Tofu
description: Charred tofu grilled on the barbeque with a salty and umami sauce
steps: Compress the tofu block with 2 plates and a weight to squeeze out the liquid.
Slice into strips.
Prepare the sauce.
Chop garlic & ginger.
Add soya sauce, rice vinegar, lemon juice, and chopped ingredients to a bowl.
Dip slices of tofu into the sauce.
Grill on medium-high for 7 minutes on each side.
Brush on sauce while cooking.

title: Beet Mint Juice
steps: add chopped mint to beet juice
warm honey in microwave and stir in

title: Beef Vindaloo
description: Spicy & red with tender beef serving 3 (rice extra)
steps: Use a mortar and pestle grind the cloves and fennel seeds
Dice onions, tomato, and mince garlic and ginger
Sautee in olive oil the onions, tomatoes, garlic, and ginger for 5 minutes
Add the coconut milk, tomato paste, wine, and all the spices
Chop steak in chunks
Add in steak
Simmer till beef is cooked (~15 minutes on low-medium) and red color has darkened
Salt to taste and squeeze in lime
Garnish with chopped corriander
